alert.note: Alert for Stone; Taney (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued December 17 at 4:50PM CST until December 17 at 11:00PM CST by NWS Springfield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Springfield has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southern Stone County in southwestern Missouri... Northwestern Taney County in southwestern Missouri... * Until 1100 PM CST Friday. * At 450 PM CST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Branson, Kimberling City, Forsyth, Hollister, Silver Dollar City, Merriam Woods, Rockaway Beach and Indian Point. This includes the following low water crossings... Roark Creek at Expressway Lane, Trigger Creek at Highway J, Stout Creek at Hulls Ford Road, Caney Creek at Caney Creek RD and Little Beaver Creek at Old Cheese Plant Road. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
